title: Chartered Accountant Job at Edgewood Consulting Limited
content:
Edgewood Consulting Limited - Our client is recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Chartered Accountant
Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Develop and implement financial responsibility plans aligned with organizational strategy.
	Ensure timely and accurate completion of the month-end accounting process.
	Coordinate and process various financial, administrative, and operational forms and reports.
	Maintain up-to-date financial records, ensuring the accuracy of transactions and changes.
	Proactively identify and implement financial solutions to improve service levels.
	Provide accurate financial reporting to Management, ensuring compliance with statutory requirements.
	Establish standards and procedures for internal and third-party payments.
	Participate in financial audits and provide necessary documentation.
	Prepare balance sheets, and invoices, and handle client financial interactions.
	Drive financial efficiency and cost-saving culture across all business areas.
	Review and recommend internal financial requests for management approval.
	Organize and maintain electronic filing of invoices.
	Track invoices from receipt to final payment, ensuring reconciliation with vendors.
	Ensure compliance with company policies, procedures, and regulatory requirements.
	Maintain accurate records on accounts receivable and payable.
	Manage monthly deduction and remittance of statutory payments (PAYE, WHT, Pension, VAT).
	Handle annual company tax returns and monthly bank statement reconciliation.
	Conduct vendor reconciliation and analyze industry trends for improvement opportunities.
	Perform quarterly budget analysis, comparing forecast to actual spending.
	Create and implement financial policies to enhance operational efficiency.
	Ensure compliance with corporate policies, internal controls, and accounting standards.
	Understand cost drivers for accurate budgeting and forecasting.


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance, Business, a related field, or equivalent practical experience
	4-5 years of accounting practice and/or industry experience
	Experience with International Financial Reporting Standards
	ACA/ACCA or Equivalent is required
	Strong working knowledge of Accounting software and Microsoft Office
	High-energy, self-motivated, team player with a desire to excel in demanding and fast paced detailed oriented environment
	Ability to adapt quickly, work independently, take ownership, and work in a flexible team environment
	Good understanding of Tax compliance
	Ability and willingness to meet business critical deadlines.
	Ability to work independently and be responsible to follow up on action items.
	Excellent verbal, interpersonal and written communication skills.
	Strong analytical, problem-solving and decision-making capabilities.
	Team player with the ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
	Ability to work with all levels of internal staff as well as outside clients and vendors


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: edgewoodconsultingofficial@gmail.com using "Chartered Accountant" as the subject of the email.

title: Python Developer Job at Odixcity Consulting
content:
Odixcity Consulting is an International Hr consulting and procurement firm. With expertise in Recruitment & Selection, Performance management, Training & Development, Compensation and benefits as well as Outsourcing of goods and services for organizations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Python Developer

Job Location:  Remote

Job Summary


	We are looking for a talented Python Developer to join our engineering team and help build robust, scalable systems.


Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Write clean, efficient, and reuseable Python codes.
	Build and maintain back-end services, APIs, and data pipelines.
	Identify and address technical challenges, finding optimal solutions, and optimizing application performance.
	Write unit and integration tests for code reliability.
	Collaborate with front-end developers, designers, and product managers.
	Develop, test, and deploy new features and fixes.
	Integrate with databases, third-party services, and external APIs.
	Analyzing data, identifying trends, and providing insights to support business decisions.
	Implementing security measures to protect data and applications from unauthorized access and cyber threats.


Requirements and Experience


	Strong proficiency in Python (3.x)
	Experience with at least one framework; Django, Flask, or FastAPI.
	Solid understanding of RESTful APIs and microservice architecture.
	Experience with databases (PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB).
	Familiarity with version control systems (Git).
	Experience with DevOps tools (Docker, Kubernetes, CI/CD).
	Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP).
	Exposure to data engineering or machine learning principles.
	Understanding of asynchronous programming and message queues (Celery, RabbitMQ, Kafka).
	Strong debugging and problem-solving skills.


Salary
N400,000 Monthly (non-negotiable).

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: jobscandidate8@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Finance Manager Job at FairMoney
content:
FairMoney is building the leading mobile bank for emerging markets. We started with a digital microcredit application on Android, and currently roll out additional financial services (current account, savings, debit card) while expanding the product to Western Africa and South-East Asia.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Finance Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time (Hybrid)

Responsibilities
Monthly Management Reporting:
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Review monthly management report prepared by accountants and sign off.
	Ensure there are relevant schedules supporting the items on the financial statement.
	Train and motivate accountants.
	Resolve issues raised by the financial control units and other reviewers timely and accurately.


Variance Analysis:


	Identify drivers for financial statements line items.
	Analyse the variance between actuals and budget as well as change over time.
	Recommend corrective actions for adverse variances.


Regulatory Reporting:


	Ensure CBN returns is submitted on or before the 5th day of the month.
	Ensure the NDIC report and other regulatory returns are submitted as at when due.
	Manage CBN audits.


Year End Close/Statutory Audits:


	Lead the annual statutory audit.


Requirements
The ideal candidate will be


	 A qualified Accountant (ACCA, ICAN).
	Have a minimum of seven (7) years of experience.
	Experience in audit and/or financial service industry is necessary.
	 Must be very good with IFRS.
	Have an Advanced Microsoft Excel Skills.
	SQL and other data analytics skills are major advantage.
	Must have excellent leadership and interpersonal skills.
	Be an effective team player with a positive attitude.
	Must be able to work without supervision.


Benefits


	Private Health Insurance.
	Pension Plan.
	Paid Time Off.
	Hybrid Work Model.
	Training & Development.


Recruitment Process


	A screening interview with one of the members of the Talent Acquisition team.
	Technical Interview with the Chief Financial Officer.
